Detailed Description

There are several different structs used throughout our code used to represent the data sent to/from our robot.

For Rx (robot to soccer), this includes:

  • RTP. This is the packed format we use to send to and from real robots
  • sim. This is a protobuf-based format used to communicate with sim
  • RobotStatus. This is the in-memory representation used in Context.
  • Packet::RadioRx. This is the representation used in the log frame.

For Tx (soccer to robot), the structs are similar with one exception: instead of a single equivalent to RobotStatus, in-memory representations of Tx data is split across RobotIntent and MotionSetpoint.
